meanings.definition: A person or thing that concentrates.
meanings.sent1: The student was a diligent concentrators during the exam.
meanings.sent2: The concentrators of the team helped them win the game.
meanings.sent3: The little ant was a concentrators, focusing on carrying food back to its nest.
meanings.sent4: Her concentrators on the task at hand was like a laser beam, unwavering and precise.
meanings.sent5: The concentrators of the sunlight through the magnifying glass started a small fire.

meanings.definition: A device that increases the strength of a signal or substance.
meanings.sent1: The new concentrators improved the wifi signal in the house.
meanings.sent2: The concentrators in the lab helped amplify the chemical reactions.
meanings.sent3: The concentrators hummed softly as they boosted the music playing.
meanings.sent4: The concentrators acted like a superhero, enhancing the power of the signal.
meanings.sent5: The concentrators in the telescope made the stars appear brighter and clearer.

meanings.definition: A substance that increases the concentration of a solution.
meanings.sent1: The chemist added the concentrators to make the solution more potent.
meanings.sent2: The concentrators in the drink made it taste stronger.
meanings.sent3: The concentrators in the soup made it so thick, it was almost like a stew.
meanings.sent4: The concentrators mixed in easily, making the solution more effective.
meanings.sent5: The concentrators in the dye made the color more vibrant and intense.
